meanings.definition: Departing from a recognized, conventional, or established norm or pattern.
meanings.sent1: The eccentric artist painted the sky purple instead of blue.
meanings.sent2: Her eccentric taste in fashion always stood out in a crowd.
meanings.sent3: The eccentric cat decided to meow at the birds instead of chasing them.
meanings.sent4: The eccentric clock ticked backwards, defying time itself.
meanings.sent5: The eccentric old house had windows of all shapes and sizes, like a whimsical puzzle.

meanings.definition: A person who has an unconventional or slightly strange behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The eccentric at the park fed the squirrels while wearing a top hat.
meanings.sent2: Everyone in the town knew the eccentric who collected rubber ducks.
meanings.sent3: The eccentric at the party juggled pineapples to entertain the guests.
meanings.sent4: She was the eccentric of the neighborhood, always walking her pet ferret on a leash.
meanings.sent5: The eccentric professor wore mismatched socks and spoke to his plants every morning.
